Class FileStorage

java.lang.Object
FileStorage
public class FileStorage extends Object
Manages storage operations for the server or client, including file hashing, block retrieval, file saving, and writing client/server statistics.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private final String
    baseDirectory
    The base directory where files are stored or retrieved from.
    private final int
    blockSize
    The size (in bytes) of each block when reading or writing file chunks.
    private static final Logger
    logger
    Logger instance for recording informational and error messages related to file storage operations.
    private final DecimalFormat
    timeFormat
    Formatter used to format time values in seconds with six decimal places and a dot as the decimal separator.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    FileStorage(String baseDirectory, int blockSize)
    Constructs a FileStorage instance tied to a specific directory and block size.

      private static final Logger logger
      Logger instance for recording informational and error messages related to file storage operations.

    • baseDirectory

      The base directory where files are stored or retrieved from.

    • blockSize

      private final int blockSize
      The size (in bytes) of each block when reading or writing file chunks.

      Formatter used to format time values in seconds with six decimal places and a dot as the decimal separator.

  • Constructor Details

    • FileStorage

      public FileStorage(String baseDirectory, int blockSize)
      Constructs a FileStorage instance tied to a specific directory and block size.
      Parameters:
      baseDirectory - the directory path where files are stored
      blockSize - the number of bytes per file block

  • Method Details

    • writeClientStats

      public void writeClientStats(long time, int gotHelped, int helped, ClientConfig config)
      Writes client statistics to a CSV file named based on the client's port.
      Parameters:
      time - time in milliseconds to download the file
      gotHelped - number of times the client received token from trusted client
      helped - number of times the client send token as trusted client
      config - the ClientConfig instance associated with the client

    • writeServerStats

      public void writeServerStats(int closed)
      Writes server statistics (e.g., number of closed connections) to a fixed CSV file.
      Parameters:
      closed - number of connections closed by the server

    • writeLinesToFile

      private void writeLinesToFile(String fileName, List<String> lines)
      Writes lines of text to a file, overwriting existing content.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the target file path
      lines - the content lines to write

    • getFiles

      public List<ServerFile> getFiles()
      Returns a list of available files as ServerFile objects. Uses the SHA-256 hash of the file content as the file identifier.
      Returns:
      a list of files with their SHA-256 and MD5 hashes

    • generateHash

      private String generateHash(File file, String algorithm) throws IOException, NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Computes a hash for a given file using the specified algorithm.
      Parameters:
      file - the file to hash
      algorithm - hash algorithm name ("MD5", "SHA-256")
      Returns:
      hexadecimal string representation of the hash
      Throws:
      IOException - if reading the file fails
      NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the algorithm is not available

    • getMD5

      public String getMD5(String filename) throws IOException, NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Returns the MD5 checksum of the specified file.
      Parameters:
      filename - name of the file to hash
      Returns:
      the MD5 hash string
      Throws:
      IOException - if file reading fails
      NoSuchAlgorithmException - if MD5 algorithm is unavailable

    • getBlock

      public byte[] getBlock(String filename, int blockIndex) throws IOException
      Retrieves a specific block of a file based on the block index.
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file
      blockIndex - the index of the block to retrieve (0-based)
      Returns:
      a byte array containing the requested block, or an empty array if index is out of range
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file does not exist or cannot be read

    • saveFile

      public void saveFile(byte[] fileData, String fileName)
      Saves a byte array as a file in the configured base directory.
      Parameters:
      fileData - the byte content of the file
      fileName - the name to assign to the saved file
